trans-unit.source: Defines an area that receives and displays ink strokes.
An <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> is an element that can be used to receive and display ink input.
This is commonly done through the use of a stylus, which interacts with a digitizer to produce ink strokes using a stylus or a mouse.
The created strokes are represented as <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> objects, and can be manipulated either programmatically or based on user input.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> enables users to modify or delete an existing <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> can be bound to a data source.

For example, you can bind the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Strokes%2A> property to: a base-64, encoded string that contains ink data in Ink Serialized format (ISF); or even to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Strokes%2A> property of another <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>.
You can also bind properties, such as <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.DefaultDrawingAttributes%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A>, to other data sources.
Initializes a new instance of the InkCanvas class.
Gets the current editing mode of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.ActiveEditingMode%2A> property indicates the current <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasEditingMode> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>.

Suppose that the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A> is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasEditingMode.Ink> and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingModeInverted%2A> is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasEditingMode.EraseByPoint>.
When the tablet pen is used in an inverted position, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.ActiveEditingMode%2A> has a value of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasEditingMode.EraseByPoint>.
Otherwise, its value is <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasEditingMode.Ink>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The current editing mode of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
Occurs when the current editing mode changes.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.ActiveEditingMode%2A> property changes whenever the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> enters a new editing mode.

For example, suppose that the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A> is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasEditingMode.Ink> and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingModeInverted%2A> is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasEditingMode.EraseByPoint>.
When the user changes the tip of tablet pen, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.ActiveEditingModeChanged> event occurs.
Routed Event Information
Identifier field
Routing strategy
Bubbling
Delegate
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.ActiveEditingModeChanged"></xref> routed event.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.ActiveEditingMode"></xref> dependency property.
Positions child elements and determines a size for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref> object.
The final area within the parent that this element should use to arrange itself and its children.
The actual size used.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Brush"></xref>.
The brush is used to fill the border area surrounding a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.SubPropertiesDoNotAffectRender%2A>
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Brush"></xref> used to fill the border area surrounding a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Background"></xref> dependency property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Bottom"></xref> attached property.
Indicates whether the contents of the Clipboard can be pasted into the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> can support Clipboard data in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] format, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_isf](~/includes/tlasharptla-isf-md.md)], and text format.
`true` if the contents of the Clipboard can be pasted in; otherwise, `false`.
Retrieves child elements of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
XAML Property Element Usage
XAML Values
*OneOrMoreUIElements*
One or more <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> objects.
A collection of child elements located on the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
Copies selected strokes and/or elements to the Clipboard.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> can support Clipboard data in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] format, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_isf](~/includes/tlasharptla-isf-md.md)], and text format.
Strokes to the Clipboard are both [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] format, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_isf](~/includes/tlasharptla-isf-md.md)].
Deletes the selected strokes and elements, and copies them to the Clipboard.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> can support Clipboard data in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] format, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_isf](~/includes/tlasharptla-isf-md.md)], and text format.
Strokes to the Clipboard are both [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] format, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_isf](~/includes/tlasharptla-isf-md.md)].
Gets or sets the drawing attributes that are applied to new ink strokes made on the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
Setting this property will affect only new strokes that are made after this property is set.
To apply new drawing attributes to already-created <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> objects, access them individually using the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Strokes%2A> property.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The default drawing attributes for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.DefaultDrawingAttributes"></xref> dependency property.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.DefaultDrawingAttributes"></xref> property is replaced.
Gets or sets the stylus point description for an <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.

By default, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> stores only the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperties.X>, <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperties.Y>, and <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPointProperties.NormalPressure> properties for each <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPoint> belonging to a stroke.
You can use the DefaultStylusPointDescription property to store additional information about points comprising the strokes on a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>.
Setting this property will affect only new strokes that are made after the property is set.
XAML Text Usage
You cannot use this property in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)].
The stylus point description for an <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
Gets or sets the renderer that dynamically draws ink on the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
You can set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.DynamicRenderer%2A> property to a custom <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.DynamicRenderer> if you want to customize the ink.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.DynamicRenderer%2A> is a member of the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.StylusPlugIns%2A> collection.

When you set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.DynamicRenderer%2A>, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> removes the old <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.DynamicRenderer> from the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugInCollection> and adds the new <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.DynamicRenderer> to the end of the collection.
This may change the behavior of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>.
The renderer that dynamically draws ink on the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
Gets or sets the user editing mode used by an active pointing device.
The default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A> is <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasEditingMode.Ink>.
Changing the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A> clears any existing selections.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A> specifies the mode of the pointing device as it interacts with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingModeInverted%2A> is used by some digitizers when the "eraser end" of the stylus contacts the digitizer.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The editing mode used when a pointing device (such as a tablet pen or mouse) is active.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode"></xref> property of an <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref> object has been changed.

This event occurs after the editing mode has been changed; the changes are reflected in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>.
Routed Event Information
Identifier field
Routing strategy
Bubbling
Delegate
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingModeChanged"></xref> routed event.
Gets or sets the user editing mode if the stylus is inverted when it interacts with the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
This property controls the actions that are performed when the stylus is inverted.
Similarly, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A> property controls actions that are performed when the stylus is in a standard, tip-down position against the digitizer,
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The inverted editing mode of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingModeInverted"></xref> property of an <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref> object has been changed.
This event occurs after the inverted editing mode has been changed.
These changes are reflected in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingModeInverted%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>.
Routed Event Information
Identifier field
Routing strategy
Bubbling
Delegate
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingModeInvertedChanged"></xref> routed event.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingModeInverted"></xref> dependency property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StylusShape"></xref> used to point-erase ink from an <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.

This shape will be used to erase ink from an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> when the current <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A> is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasEditingMode.EraseByPoint>.
Individual properties of a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StylusShape> cannot be modified once the shape has been created.

If you change the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EraserShape%2A>, the cursor rendered on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> is not updated until the next <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A> change.
XAML Text Usage
This property is not typically used in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)].
The eraser shape associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref> detects a gesture.
Routed Event Information
Identifier field
Routing strategy
Bubbling
Delegate
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Gesture"></xref> routed event.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Bottom"></xref> attached property for a given dependency object.
The element of which to get the bottom property.
The bottom coordinate of the dependency object.
Returns a collection of application gestures that are recognized by <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
A collection of gestures that the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref> recognizes.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.IsGestureRecognizerAvailable"></xref> property is `false`.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Left"></xref> attached property for a given dependency object.
The element of which to get the left property.
The left coordinate of the dependency object.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Right"></xref> attached property for a given dependency object.
The element of which to get the right property.
The right coordinate of the dependency object.
Retrieves the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement"></xref> objects that are selected in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
This method returns only <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> objects, not <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> objects.
To retrieve selected <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> objects, call the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.GetSelectedStrokes%2A> method.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A> of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A>, users can select <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> objects and <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> objects.
Alternatively, both types of objects can be selected using code: just call the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Select%2A> method.
Array of <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement"></xref> objects.

Retrieves a <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> that represents selected <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> objects on the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
This method returns <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> objects, only.
To retrieve selected <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> objects, call the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.GetSelectedElements%2A> method.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A> of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A>, users can select <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> objects and <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> objects.
Alternatively, both types of objects can be selected using code: just call the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Select%2A> method.
The collection of selected strokes.
Gets the bounds of the selected strokes and elements on the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
The smallest rectangle that encompasses all selected strokes and elements.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Top"></xref> attached property for a given dependency object.
The element of which to get the top property.
The top coordinate of the dependency object.
Overrides <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual.GetVisualChild(System.Int32)"></xref>, and returns a child at the specified index from a collection of child elements.
The zero-based index of the requested child element in the collection.
The requested child element.
This should not return `null`; if the provided index is out of range, an exception is thrown.
Determines whether a given point falls within the rendering bounds of an <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
An object that specifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> to hit test against.
An object that represents the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> that is returned from a hit test.
Returns a value that indicates which part of the selection adorner intersects or surrounds the specified point.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.HitTestSelection%2A> method to determine whether the point is within a stroke selection's bounds or on one of the eight handles.
This is useful when performing drag and drop operations.
The point to hit test.
A value that indicates which part of the selection adorner intersects or surrounds a specified point.
Gets the ink presenter that displays ink on the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
The ink presenter that displays ink on the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
Gets (determines) whether the gesture recognition component is available on the user's system.
`true` if the recognition component is available; otherwise, `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Left"></xref> attached property.
Returns enumerator to logical children.
Measures the size in layout required for child elements and determines a size for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref> object.
The available size that this element can give to child elements.
Infinity can be specified as a value to indicate that the element will size to whatever content is available.
The size that this element determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of child element sizes.
Gets or sets a Boolean value which indicates whether the user is enabled to move selected ink strokes and/or elements on the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
If this property is set to `true`, an adorner border is drawn around ink strokes and/or elements when they are selected.
This border enables the user to move the selected objects.
If <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.ResizeEnabled%2A> is `true`, the adorner enables the user to resize the strokes and/or elements as well.
If this property is set to `false` while one or more ink strokes and/or elements are selected, the adorner border will be automatically removed from the selected objects.
`true` if a user can move strokes and/or elements on the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.ActiveEditingModeChanged"></xref> event.
The event data.

Provides an appropriate <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.InkCanvasAutomationPeer"></xref> implementation for this control, as part of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.DefaultDrawingAttributesReplaced"></xref> event.
The event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingModeChanged"></xref> event.

This event occurs after the editing mode has been changed; the changes are reflected in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>.
The event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingModeInvertedChanged"></xref> event.

This event occurs after the inverted editing mode has been changed; the changes reflected in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingModeInverted%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>.
The event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Gesture"></xref> event.
The event data.
Invoked whenever the effective value of any dependency property on this <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement"></xref> has been updated.
The specific dependency property that changed is reported in the arguments parameter.
Overrides <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyObject.OnPropertyChanged(System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)"></xref>.
The event data that describes the property that changed, as well as old and new values.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.SelectionChanged"></xref> event.
This method is called after a set of ink strokes and/or elements has been selected by the user and the selection change has been applied.
Before the change is applied, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.OnSelectionChanging%2A> method is called.
The event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.SelectionChanging"></xref> event.
This method is called when a new selection of strokes and/or elements is made by the user, but before the change is applied.
After the change has been applied, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.OnSelectionChanged%2A> method is called.
The event data.
An event announcing that the user selected and moved a selection of strokes and/or elements.
This method is called after a selection of strokes and/or elements has been moved by the user and the change has been applied.
Before the change is applied, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.OnSelectionMoving%2A> method is called.
Not used.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.SelectionMoving"></xref> event.
This method is called after the user requests that a selection of strokes and/or elements be moved and before the change is applied.
After the change is applied, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.OnSelectionMoved%2A> method is called.
The event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.SelectionResized"></xref> event.
This method is called after a selection of strokes and/or elements has been resized by the user and the change has been applied.
Before the change is applied, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.OnSelectionResizing%2A> method is called.
The event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.SelectionResizing"></xref> event.
This method is called after the user requests a selection of strokes and/or elements be resized and before the change is applied.
After the change is applied, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.OnSelectionResized%2A> method will be called.
The event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.StrokeCollected"></xref> event.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.OnStrokeCollected%2A> is called when a user physically completes a stroke, for example, by raising the stylus from a tablet after making a motion.
A programmatic addition of strokes to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Strokes%2A> collection will not call the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.OnStrokeCollected%2A> method.
The event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.StrokeErased"></xref> event.
The event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.StrokeErasing"></xref> event.
The event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.StrokesReplaced"></xref> event.
The event data.
Pastes the contents of the Clipboard to the top-left corner of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> can support Clipboard data in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] format, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_isf](~/includes/tlasharptla-isf-md.md)], and text format.
Pastes the contents of the Clipboard to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref> at a given point.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> can support Clipboard data in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] format, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_isf](~/includes/tlasharptla-isf-md.md)], and text format.
The point at which to paste the strokes.
Gets or sets formats that can be pasted onto the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
XAML Property Element Usage
XAML Values
*InkCanvasClipboardFormats*
An array of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasClipboardFormat> enumeration values.
Specifying an array in XAML requires `x:Array` usage.
Specifying an enumeration value as an element that declares an array member requires `x:Static` usage.

For more information, see [x:Array Markup Extension](~/docs/framework/xaml-services/x-array-markup-extension.md) and [x:Static Markup Extension](~/docs/framework/xaml-services/x-static-markup-extension.md).
A collection of enumeration values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasClipboardFormat.InkSerializedFormat"></xref>.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the user can resize selected ink strokes and/or elements on the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
If this property is set to `true`, an adorner border is drawn around ink strokes and/or elements when they are selected.
This border enables the user to resize the selected objects.
If <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.MoveEnabled%2A> is `true`, the adorner enables the user to move the strokes and/or elements as well.
If this property is set to `false` while one or more ink strokes and/or elements are selected, the adorner border is automatically removed from the selected objects.
`true` if a user can resize strokes and/or elements on the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Right"></xref> attached propertyy.
Selects a set of <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> objects.

An <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> can contain <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> objects, which are created in response to user stylus input and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> objects, such as <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Image> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> objects.
Selected strokes are displayed with an adorner around them for ease of recognition and manipulation.
<xref:System.Windows.UIElement> objects will not display differently when selected.
If a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> in `selectedElements` is not in the Children collection, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Select%2A> ignores the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement>.
A collection of <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> objects to select.
Selects a set of ink <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> objects.

An <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> can contain <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> objects, which are created in response to user stylus input, and <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> objects, such as <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Image> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> objects.
Selected strokes are displayed with an adorner around them for ease of recognition and manipulation.
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> objects do not display differently when selected.
A collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> objects to select.
One or more strokes in selectedStrokes is not in the property.
Selects a combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> objects.

An <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> can contain <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> objects, which are created in response to user stylus input and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> objects, such as <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Image> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> objects.
Selected strokes will be displayed with an adorner around them for ease of recognition and manipulation.
<xref:System.Windows.UIElement> objects will not display differently when selected.
If a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> in `selectedElements` is not in the Children collection, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Select%2A> ignores the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement>.
A collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> objects to select.
A collection of <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> objects to select.
One or more strokes in selectedStrokes is not included in the property.
Occurs when the selection on the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref> changes.
This event is raised after a set of ink strokes and/or elements has been selected and applied by the user.

If, instead, you must handle a request that select a set of ink strokes and/or elements before the selection is applied, add an event handler to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.SelectionChanging> event.
Occurs when a new set of ink strokes and/or elements is being selected.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.SelectionChanging> event is raised when strokes and/or elements are selected by the user - but before the change is applied.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.SelectionChanging> event is processed when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasSelectionChangingEventHandler> receives an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasSelectionChangingEventArgs> object.

<xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasSelectionChangingEventArgs> provides methods for accessing <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> and <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> objects after they are selected by the user.
After the change is applied, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.SelectionChanged> event is raised.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.SelectionChanging> event does not occur when the selected strokes are deleted or when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.ActiveEditingMode%2A> property changes.
Occurs after the user moves a selection of strokes and/or elements.
This event occurs after a selection of strokes and/or elements is moved, but before the stroke or element data is updated to record its new position.
Add an event handler to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.SelectionMoving> event.
Occurs before selected strokes and elements are moved.
This event occurs after the user requests that a selection of strokes and/or elements be moved, but before the change is applied.

The event handler receives an argument of type <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasSelectionEditingEventArgs> with two properties: <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasSelectionEditingEventArgs.OldRectangle%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasSelectionEditingEventArgs.NewRectangle%2A>.

<xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasSelectionEditingEventArgs.OldRectangle%2A> defines the boundaries of the selection before the move and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasSelectionEditingEventArgs.NewRectangle%2A> defines the boundaries of the selection after the move.
After the change is applied, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.SelectionMoved> event will occur.
Occurs when a selection of strokes and/or elements has been resized by the user.
This event is raised after a selection of strokes and/or elements is resized.

If, instead, you must handle a request to resize a selection before the strokes and/or elements are resized, add an event handler to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.SelectionResizing> event.
Occurs before selected strokes and elements are resized.
This event occurs after the user requests that a selection of strokes and/or elements be resized, but before the change is applied.

The event handler receives an argument of type <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasSelectionEditingEventArgs> that contains two properties: <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasSelectionEditingEventArgs.OldRectangle%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasSelectionEditingEventArgs.NewRectangle%2A>.

<xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasSelectionEditingEventArgs.OldRectangle%2A> defines the boundaries of the selection before the resizing operation and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasSelectionEditingEventArgs.NewRectangle%2A> defines the boundaries of the selection after the resizing operation.
After the strokes and/or elements are updated with the new size, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.SelectionResized> event is raised.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Bottom"></xref> attached property for a given dependency object.
The element on which to set the bottom property.
The bottom coordinate of element.
Sets the application gestures that the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref> will recognize.
The following example demonstrates how to set up an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> to recognize application gestures.

[!code-csharp[GestureSample#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/GestureSample/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#3)] [!code-vb[GestureSample#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/GestureSample/VisualBasic/Window1.xaml.vb#3)]

[!code-csharp[GestureSample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/GestureSample/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#1)] [!code-vb[GestureSample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/GestureSample/VisualBasic/Window1.xaml.vb#1)]
A collection of application gestures that the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref> will recognize.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.IsGestureRecognizerAvailable"></xref> property is `false`.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Left"></xref> attached property for a given dependency object.
The element on which to set the left property.
The left coordinate of element.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Right"></xref> attached property for a given dependency object.
The element on which to set the right property.
The right coordinate of element.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Top"></xref> attached property for a given dependency object.
The element on which to set the top property.
The top coordinate of element.
Occurs when a stroke drawn by the user is added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Strokes"></xref> property.
This event is raised when a user completes a stroke using a pointing device.
For example, a user might raise a stylus from a digitizer after making a motion, thereby completing a stroke.
The event handler receives an argument of type <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasStrokeCollectedEventArgs>, which references the completed stroke.
The stroke is also added to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Strokes%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>.
The programmatic addition of a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> object to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Strokes%2A> collection does not raise this event.
Routed Event Information
Identifier field
Routing strategy
Bubbling
Delegate
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.StrokeCollected"></xref> routed event.
Occurs when user erases a stroke.

This event occurs when a user erases ink whether the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasEditingMode.EraseByPoint> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasEditingMode.EraseByStroke>.
Routed Event Information
Identifier field
Routing strategy
Bubbling
Delegate
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.StrokeErased"></xref> routed event.
Occurs just before a user erases a stroke.
Handle this event when you want to check whether a stroke should be erased.
Set the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true` if you want to prevent the stroke from being erased.

You can use this technique when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingModeInverted%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasEditingMode.EraseByStroke> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvasEditingMode.EraseByPoint>.
Gets or sets the collection of ink <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> objects collected by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.Stroke"></xref> objects contained within the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Strokes"></xref> dependency property.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Strokes"></xref> property is replaced.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.Top"></xref> attached property.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether to override standard <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref> cursor functionality to support a custom cursor.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> will change the cursor style to reflect the current <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A> while the cursor is within the bounds of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas>.

If this behavior is not wanted, for example, when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> uses a custom cursor, set this property to `true`, and the cursor will not change with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas.EditingMode%2A>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref> is using a custom cursor; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the number of visual child elements within this element.
The number of visual child elements for this element.
Adds the specified object to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas"></xref>.
The child object to add.
Adds the text that within the tags in markup.
Always throws an <xref href="System.ArgumentException"></xref>.
Not used.
